title: Copepod Swimming Biomechanics: Pleopod Articulations in Labidocera aestiva
content: Copepods are the most numerous multicellular organisms on planet earth being found in all aquatic environments. Most copepods are planktonic, being carried by wind, waves, and tides. While most copepods are filter feeders, Labidocera is the exception. Labidocera is a raptorial hunter with tri-partite eyes that scan the environment for motion produced by potential prey.
